content: ZHENG Tianyue - Faculty - SUSTech Menu News E-Hall ä¸­æ Academic Calendar Notice News Academic Calendar Notice Library News Admissions Global  ä¸­æ   Â© 2019 All Rights Reserved.ç½ç«è®¾è®¡æ¯æ ç²¤ICPå¤14051456å· ä¸­æ Home News Events About Overview Mission & Vision Leadership The Development Plan University Governance Milestones Facts Gallery Contact us Faculty Overview High-level Talents Talent Program Directory Academics Overview View Programs Undergraduate Education Graduate Education Overseas Studies Schools and Colleges International students Research Overview Research Centers & Facilities Technology Transfer Research News Research Administration Go Global Campus Life Overview Residential College Housing & Dining Clubs & Organizations Email Library Admissions Give University Intranets Old Site Faculty ä¸­æ Go Back Search ZHENG Tianyue Assistant Professor zhengty@sustech.edu.cn Personal Homepage ZHENG Tianyue is an Assistant Professor in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering at Southern University of Science and Technology. He is also a doctoral supervisor. He obtained his Ph.D. degree from Nanyang Technological University in Singapore, master's degree from the University of Toronto in Canada, and bachelor's degree from Harbin Institute of Technology in China. His research mainly focuses on mobile computing, pervasive computing, wireless sensing, sensing security, federated learning, and autonomous driving. He has published multiple papers in top-tier conferences and journals such as ACM MobiCom, CCS, UbiComp, SenSys, IEEE TMC, JSAC, ICCV, and INFOCOM. He serves as TPC/AEC member and reviewer for several top-tier conferences and journals.Publications(* denotes co-first author.)ConferencePassword-Stealing without Hacking: Wi-Fi Enabled Practical Keystroke EavesdroppingJingyang Hu, Hongbo Wang, Tianyue Zheng, Jingzhi Hu, Zhe Chen, and Jun Luo,in Proc. of the 30th ACM CCS, 2023, pp. 1â14. MUSE-Fi: Contactless MUti-person SEnsing Exploiting Near-field Wi-Fi Channel VariationJingzhi Hu*, Tianyue Zheng*, Zhe Chen, Hongbo Wang, and Jun Luo,in Proc. of the 29th ACM MobiCom, 2023, pp. 1â12. OCHID-Fi: Occlusion-Robust Hand Pose Estimation in 3D via RF-VisionShujie Zhang*, Tianyue Zheng*, Zhe Chen, Jingzhi Hu, Abdelwahed Khamis, Jiajun Liu, and Jun Luo,in Proc. of IEEE/CVF ICCV, 2023, pp. 1â10. AutoFed: Heterogeneity-Aware Federated Multimodal Learning for Robust Autonomous DrivingTianyue Zheng, Ang Li, Zhe Chen, Hongbo Wang, and Jun Luo,in Proc. of the 29th ACM MobiCom, 2023, pp. 1â12. Wider is Better?
